title: December 2024 Newsletter Updates
description: Continue.dev released enhanced context awareness features including improved Git integration to see recent changes, better copy buffer integration when relevant, and expanded support for relevant code definitions across many languages. Also added support for Claude 3.5 Sonnet and DeepSeek Coder v2 models.

community_feedback.quote: Pleasantly surprised by Continue.Dev! Getting 45 tokens/second with Llama-8b on M1. Continue has taken serious notes from Cursor. Considering canceling Cursor subscription in favor of Continue
Continue.Dev autocomplete too wasteful, going back to Copilot. Very trigger happy, suggests several lines of code without context or prior information
User requested ability to disable auto-autocomplete and wanted manual trigger with keyboard shortcut (CTRL-SHIFT-SPACE), showing ongoing development based on user feedback

title: Copilot Workspace December 6th Update
description: GitHub Copilot Workspace added image preview support allowing users to preview images directly in the Workspace editor, and enhanced the token window to 64k tokens for Copilot Chat, facilitating better responses when working on large codebases.

community_feedback.quote: Some users on Reddit mentioned that Copilot Workspace is 'being underestimated' and provides exactly what they expect from an AI co-worker
Users appreciate its cloud-based nature, repository access, and automatic PR capabilities
Some users reported the beta 'failed to complete simple tasks' and 'performed worse than expected'. Concerns include not following coding conventions

title: December '24 Product Update - Part 1
description: Devin AI introduced improved Slack integration that better mirrors working with human teammates, enhanced Knowledge capabilities where Devin proposes new information to remember for future conversations, and session management features that can be used as a todo list.

community_feedback.quote: Some users found it 'pretty impressive' for creating plans, writing code, finding and fixing bugs
Others questioned if it delivers on the 'autonomous software engineer' promises
Pricing concerns at $500/month starting point raises questions about value compared to alternatives like Cursor
Performance concerns (14 minutes to handle login tasks at $100/hour rates)
